content: SeedlyTV EP06 CPF Asked by AnonymousAsked on 12 Jun 2019My mom is not in CPF LIfe. She's 70+ now. If she wants to withdraw her money from CPF RA, is there any limits / restrictions for her?My mom is not in CPF LIfe. She's 70+ now. If she wants to withdraw monies from CPF RA, is there any limits / restrictions for her?4 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (4)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

CPF BoardLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 26 Jun 2019Hi,As we will need your mother’s personal information for us to check and assist you better, please call 1800 227 1188 / +65 6227 1188 (overseas) from Monday to Friday, 8am to 5.30pm, or write in at cpf.gov.sg/writetous.
Thank you.0 comments7

DeleteEditHariz Arthur Maloy, Independent Financial Advisor at Promiseland IndependentTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomUpdated on 12 Jun 2019She might be in the Retirement Sum Scheme.Simplest way to find out is just to make a trip down to CPF and inquire with the officers. :)3 comments4

See all 3 comments Lim Huay Ling12 Jun 2019Thanks for respondHariz Arthur Maloy12 Jun 2019DeleteEditIf she has singpass, can try and log into CPF and see how much can be withdrawn. My grandma didn't have singpass so we went down.

Kenichi Xi, nᴉʍ oʇ dǝnᴉʇsǝd 不能说的秘密 at Tag Team with Gabriel ThamLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 13 Jun 2019Yo!​​​
You  can instruct CPF Board to start your Retirement Sum Scheme (RSS)  payouts anytime from your payout eligibility age.  To do so, please  submit
FORM RSS30: Apply for Monthly Payouts and Change Bank Details under CPF Retirement Sum Scheme (PDF, 1.0MB).For  members turning age 70 from 2018 onwards, if you have not started your  monthly payouts by age 70, the Board will do so automatically for you.  This automatic payout start age of 70 simplifies the activation process  for RSS members to receive payouts for retirement.
You can refer to this
infographic for 5 Things You Need To Know on Starting Retirement Payouts From Age 65 (PDF, 0.9MB).Source: https://www.cpf.gov.sg/Members/Schemes/schemes/retirement/retirement-sum-schemeTLDR?Just make an appointment to shorten the waiting time for your loves one.Here:https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Services/Appointments/CreateAppointmentCoverList down all the Qs and leave space for answers to write on when you do down personally!Remember to bring their IC and get it done and over with in one session.P.S Bring a coat to keep warm if the aircon is too strong.Hope my replies helps!0 comments1

Loh Tat Tian, 2nd Hand Insurance Broker / EX-FA at Singapore Insurance Value FindingLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 13 Jun 2019Any monies in the RA will be subjected to the minimum allowed monthly payout of $250 (and increases once pass $50,000 in RA). Estimated monthly payout is $550 for RA account of $112,000 in RA.So for your mum, you can't withdraw in lump sum only...0 comments0
